subject: RE: [junit] test protected method outside package
msgSnippet: Cédric, Excuse my ignorance, but I am not sure what is meant by looking up method and setAccessable(true), is setAccessable(true) a method of JUnit 3.8.1?
messageBody:
Cédric,

Excuse my ignorance, but I am not sure what is meant by "looking up method
and setAccessable(true), is setAccessable(true) a method of JUnit 3.8.1?



The Actual class and method is as below:



public class JDBCPools {







private JDBCPools(String configDir) throws JDBCPoolsException {

String poolDir = configDir + _FS + _POOL_DIR;

loadPools(poolDir);

String aliasDir = configDir + _FS + _ALIAS_DIR;

loadAliases(aliasDir);

initConnectionReaper();

}



Notice that the class is public, but the constructor is private.

And I am stumped on how to test this.

I really appreciate your help.

Thanks,

-Kamal.

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
cbeust@...
Sent: Thursday, March 02, 2006 7:18 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] test protected method outside package



Look up the method and setAccessible(true);

--
Cédric
http://testng.org <http://testng.org>


On 3/1/06, Kamal Ahmed <KAhmed@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
>
>
> Does any one know how I can test protected method outside a package?
> Without
> moving the test class into the package where the method to be tested
> resides.
>
>
>
> Method to be tested = methodA()
>
> Package = org.apache.net
>
>
>
> Test Method = testMethodA()
>
> Package = org.apache.net.test.unit
>
>
>
>
>
> Thanks,
>
> -Kamal.
>
>
